radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. The hyper echoic area in the hepatic dome measures 2.6 x 4.1 x 1.9 cm, corresponding to hemangioma previously characterized on MRI. Other hemangiomas identified on prior MRI are not seen on this examination. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. No intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 8 mm. Intimal wall stone is lodged in the neck of the gallbladder. There is trace gallbladder wall thickening and pericholecystic fluid. Sonographic Murphy's sign was positive. The imaged portion of the pancreas appears within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation. Normal echogenicity of the spleen, measuring 10.5 cm. Limited views of the right kidney show no hydronephrosis. The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Other hemangiomas identified on prior MRI are not seen on this examination.
